body:
Comment 2: 
I'm also having this issue but with a fresh install of Ubuntu 13.10.  I originally asked
about the panic in the https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-nuts/U5fehrYzQFg
thread. (sorry long)

I deleted my /usr/local/go, commented out all GOxxxx env in .bashrc, deleted old go
local clone, and closed and restarted my terminal. And was still able to reproduce the
compile time panic.

I looked over my cc -v and it looks to be the same as yours. (new lines added to mine) 
Is there any other command, or information i can gather which might shine a light on
this issue? My install of 13.10 is a basic fresh install as of today, with the current
patches.  The only other software ive knowingly installed is mercurial, sublime text2,
rubymine 6, gimp, chrome, rvm w/ ruby 2.1.1, basic-essentials.  RVM did install several
other packages, but sorry don't remember which they were.

runtime/cgo

[signal 0xb code=0x80 addr=0x0 pc=0x51cf4e]

main.run(0xc208028000, 0x233, 0x27e, 0xc208044300, 0xa, ...)

main.runGcc(0xc208028000, 0x233, 0x27e, 0xc208044300, 0xa, ...)

	/home/jasdel/Sources/go/src/cmd/cgo/gcc.go:193 +0x105 fp=0xc208059bb8

	/home/jasdel/Sources/go/src/pkg/runtime/asm_amd64.s:97 +0x120
